Thought Journal How\'d I get Here? Pros and Cons Bad Behaviors Identify Barriers ABC\'s
Pros and cons icon How\'d I get here icon Bad behaviors icon ABC\'s icon Thought journal icon Identify barriers icon
Thought journals can help you recognize and change unhelpful thought patterns. The purpose of this exercise is to get you into the habit of paying attention to your thoughts. The ABC\'s stand for Activating events, Beliefs, and Conequences. The purpose of this activity to recognize the link between the things that happen to us, unhelpful beliefs/thoughts, and the consequences of these thoughts and events. Already identified the unhelpful behavior you\'dlike to change? In this activity we will problem solve… and try to prevent the behavior next time an urge pops up! This activity can help you analyze the chain of events and reactions that contributed to a behavior step by step. So we can prevent it next time. What about good/effective bahaviors? When there was a helpful behavior or action that we planned to do but didn\'t, this activity can helps identify what stopped us from doing it. This activity can help you look at things objectively by weighing the pros and cons of continuing or stopping engagement in a specific thought, behavior, or habit. >
Send us a suggestion Have an idea for an activity you think would be helpful?
Begin! Return Next Where did the behavior occur? At what time did it occur? Morning Noonish Afternoon Evening At night Hint: A specific place, i.e home Situation Details Hint: Re-tell the events that occurred objectively, as if you are watching them in a movie Optional: What happened before you engaged in the behavior? Back Behavior What is the unhelpful behavior or action that you engaged in? Who were you with? If you weren\'t alone, enter who you were with. With others Alone What was going through your mind at the moment? Enter thoughts here! Submit Thoughts Thought Bubble Image Movie Image What is the main emotion you experienced at the time? Review Review Review Your Answers Field Optional Field Required! Submit Edit What were my thoughts? Details: Intensity: Main emotion: What did I feel? What did I do? Who was I with? When did it happen? Where did it happen? Edit Icon Review Text What was the unhelpful behavior? Situation details: What was the main emotion experienced? Intensity rating: Additional details: Thoughts experienced: Field not completed. Delete Edit Sadness Anger Fear Happiness + Behavior If I Change What is the behavior you want to change? Add Con Add pro Cons Pros How will not changing it impact my life? (Required) Optional: go into details about how you felt. I.e multiple emotions, bodily sensations, emotional actions, etc Rate the intensity of the emotion on a scale of 1–5 Emotions Enter behavior or action here What could I have done to prevent this from happening? What Happened? Yes No Willingness Was I willing to do the preventative measure or action on the previous page? Thought What can you do next time to overcome this barrier? Unhelpful action or behavior What could have I done to prevent it? Barrier type Barrier Add possible Solution Review Answers and Problem Solve! Problem Solve Final Barriers Add thought Add thoughts Thoughts Experienced What Happened? Enter the unhelpful behavior or action you engaged in here Enter what happened or what was going on What was the behavior? What was the trigger event that led you to engage in it? Thoughts and Feelings What is the main emotion you felt before engaging? What was going through your mind prior to engaging in the behavior or action? Vulnerabilities Add vulnerability factors What are some things going on (in yoruself, others, or your environment) that made you vulnerable to engaging? Add vulnerability factors Aftermath Add consequences Add relief or benefits What long term consequences will I face due to engaging? What short term relief or benefits did I get from engaging? What are some things I can do to prevent myself from engaging next time? Add preventive measures What can I do to repair the situation in the short term? Add repair ideas What thoughts did you experience? Unhelpful behavior/action: Trigger event: Main emotion experienced: What is the behavior that you would like to stop engaging in? Enter the behavior here Behavior Add environmental factor Add change What can you do about your space that can help prevent you from engaging? I.e moving triggering or dangerous material, going to another room, etc Changing Places Changing Plans What can you do in the moment to distract you from engaging? I.e call a friend, participate in a hobby, etc Add distraction Add distraction Changing the Future Add solution What can you do that will prevent you from engaging in the future? I.e practicing a helpful skill, learning a certain coping mechanism, getting professional help, etc. Helpful space changes: Helpful distractions: Things you can do to change: What can you do about your space that can help prevent you from engaging? What can you do in the moment to distract you from engaging? What can you do that will prevent you from engaging in the future? Behavior you want to stop engaging in: Insights Gain insights on your unhelpful behaviors, and say goodbye to doing all the detective work yourself! This section connects all the dots for you using your past entries Behavioral Inspection Game Plan Find Thinking Errors Take a look at those thoughts and find out what might have gone wrong. The activity in this section helps you analyze thoughts from previous entries. Some activities had you fill out ways to deal with your unhelpful behaviors. This section puts them all together for you, so you can figure out your next move! Delete item Next icon No data to display! Try filling out more forms for insights. Don\'t Change Cons Don\'t Change Pros Change Cons Change Pros
